passages.text: Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear. It will have what it has earned, and it will bear what it has incurred. Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred…
O humanity! We created you from a male and a female, and made you into peoples and tribes so that you may know one another. Surely the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous…
Indeed, Allah commands justice, excellence, and giving to relatives and forbids immorality, wrongdoing, and oppression. He instructs you so perhaps you will be mindful.

passages.sourceTitle: Hadith: Actions are by intentions (Bukhari & Muslim)
passages.text: Actions are judged by intentions, and every person will have what they intended…

passages.sourceTitle: Hadith: Make things easy, do not make them difficult (Bukhari & Muslim)
passages.text: Make things easy and do not make them difficult; give good tidings and do not drive people away.

Religious rulings (fatwa) depend on context and qualified scholarship. Use AI for learning and organizing, not as a substitute for scholars—especially for legal, financial, medical, or family matters.
When quoting Qur’an or hadith, verify the translation, chapter/verse, authenticity grading (for hadith), and scholarly interpretation. Prefer reliable references and consult teachers when unsure.
